intro: Buchnera aethiopica, commonly known as the Ethiopian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has palmate leaves. Buchnera aethiopica is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable species in its native habitat.
